Angiotensin II concentrations were found to be increased in COVID-19 infection and positively correlated with viral load and lung injury.
23 Increased ACE2 concentrations may possibly lead to a greater susceptibility for COVID-19 infection but may also be cardioprotective. This led to a crossroad in clinical decision-making: RAS blocking treatment may increase ACE2 and facilitate virus entry, but the beneficial effects it has in patients suffering from comorbid conditions cannot be ignored.
